1.rationale:
I'll look at our options from (1,3). We have several apples on the board—the one at (2,4) is very near. One clear route is to get there quickly. If we move RIGHT from (1,3), we'll reach (2,3). Then on our following turn, we can move UP to (2,4) and collect the apple. Moving UP immediately would take us to (1,4), but from there, cornering into the apple would require an extra detour (we’d then need to go RIGHT to reach (2,4)). Moreover, shifting RIGHT now gives us more flexibility in adjusting our path if needed.

There are no enemy snakes near our route—from (1,3) going RIGHT to (2,3) and then UP is clear, and we stay safely within the 10×10 boundaries.

So, my plan is to steer our snake toward the apple at (2,4), starting with a RIGHT move.
